column4: Ok.. silly question.  My cdrom drive isn't in my fstab and i'm not sure what device it is?   I tried /dev/cdrom but it says special device /dev/cdrom does not exist.  I also tried /dev/hda through /dev/hdd.
I've no idea..  it worked before when I had it installed for a long time.

Ok.. silly question.  My cdrom drive isn't in my fstab and i'm not sure what device it is?   I tried /dev/cdrom but it says special device /dev/cdrom does not exist.  I also tried /dev/hda through /dev/hdd.  None of them even exist in /dev.
nope.
ls /dev/*cd* only returns ttycd and ptycd.
So what can I do to fix it?
dmesg | grep -i cd only returns uhci_hcd stuff (USB crap)
nothing about a cdrom.
well crap.
thanks anyways.
is the cable secure to the cd?
add the words " noapic nolapic " to the end of your booting kernel line in menu.lst
and reboot?
yep
still nothing except the ttycd and ptycd when I do ls /dev/*cd*
I should have been more specific maybe - the line that ends in quiet splash is the one in menu.lst that you add to - did you do it like that/
other than that one all I had was the memtest line and the recovery mode line.  I didnt add it to those two.. i added it to the main one.
that was right
getting a forum link for similar prob with solution brb
try this - http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=3426098
it worked before and I didnt have to hcange any bios settings.
worth a check - especially if you upgraded like them in the thread
for one minutes trouble i'd check
does the live cd play/
